dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Twenty-three teenagers detained in Kazakhstan this year for drug trafficking, that's a pretty stark number to start with.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Twenty-three teenagers detained in Kazakhstan this year for drug trafficking, that's a pretty stark number to start with.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since the beginning of the year, 23 teenagers have been detained across the country on suspicion of possessing and distributing illegal substances, according to Polisia.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just older kids—we're talking about students as young as ninth grade, which is, like, what, 14 or 15 years old?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just older kids-we're talking about students as young as ninth grade, which is, like, what, fourteen or fifteen years old?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among those detained are college students and schoolchildren from grades 9 to 11.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the Ministry of Internal Affairs is really stressing that parents need to be more vigilant here.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the Ministry of Internal Affairs is really stressing that parents need to be more vigilant here.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Internal Affairs emphasized that the situation requires special attention from parents and legal guardians.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because criminal liability kicks in at 16, but even before that, the risks are huge. Ignorance of the law isn't an excuse, they're reminding everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because criminal liability kicks in at sixteen, but even before that, the risks are huge. Ignorance of the law isn't an excuse, they're reminding everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Ignorance of the law does not exempt from criminal liability. Criminal responsibility for drug-related offenses begins at age 16.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the penalties are no joke—Articles 296 and 297 mention imprisonment for possession and distribution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the penalties are no joke-Articles two hundred ninety six and two hundred ninety seven mention imprisonment for possession and distribution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to Articles 296 and 297 of the Criminal Code of the Republic of Kazakhstan, strict criminal penalties"up to imprisonment"are imposed for possession and distribution of narcotics, the ministry reminded.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, there's Article 299-1, which covers promotion online. So even sharing or posting about drugs on social media can land you in serious trouble.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, there's Article two hundred ninety nine to one, which covers promotion online. So even sharing or posting about drugs on social media can land you in serious trouble.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, Article 299-1 of the Criminal Code establishes criminal liability for the promotion and advertisement of narcotic substances, including publications on the internet and social media.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Deputy Chairman Kuandyk Alzhanov made a direct appeal to parents, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deputy Chairman Kuandyk Alzhanov made a direct appeal to parents, didn't he?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Deputy Chairman of the Committee for Combating Drug Crimes Kuandyk Alzhanov addressed parents with a call for vigilance: Dear parents and legal guardians of minors!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: He did—urging them to pay close attention to their kids' social circles and free time. It's about early intervention, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He did-urging them to pay close attention to their kids' social circles and free time. It's about early intervention, really.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We urge you to pay close attention to your children's social circles and how they spend their free time. It's important to identify risks early and prevent teens from becoming involved in illegal activities that could destroy their future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Because once they're involved, it's not just legal consequences—it's their entire future on the line.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because once they're involved, it's not just legal consequences-it's their entire future on the line.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It's important to identify risks early and prevent teens from becoming involved in illegal activities that could destroy their future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a reminder that this isn't some distant issue; it's happening in schools and colleges, right in communities.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a reminder that this isn't some distant issue; it's happening in schools and colleges, right in communities.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among those detained are college students and schoolchildren from grades 9 to 11.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the call to action is clear: parents and guardians have to step up their awareness game.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the call to action is clear: parents and guardians have to step up their awareness game.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It's one of those things where prevention is way better than dealing with the aftermath.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It's one of those things where prevention is way better than dealing with the aftermath.
